channel.title: Recent & Upcoming Talks | Boris Sedlak, TU Wien

item.title: Operating distributed computing continuum systems through active inference
item.description: I had the opportunity to speak in the online series organized by my colleague Sergio Laso at the University of Extremadura. I talked about the latest research results from our labs at TU Wien and UPF Barcelona, where we focus on optimizing the performance of large-scale computing systems, also called Computing Continuum (CC). Our methods are centered around explainable Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques, that create an interpretable understanding of the actions taken by any AI agent.

item.title: PhD Defense on Autonomous Orchestration of Computing Continuum Systems through Active Inference
item.description: While I greatly enjoyed my Ph.D., the time had to come for me to defend my thesis. It was a great pleasure to have so many interested colleagues attending and asking questions. For all those that could not attend, I attached the slides and the thesis here. This was truly a great achievement!

item.title: Operating distributed computing continuum systems through active inference
item.description: In the lovely Dubrovnik I had the opportunity to speak on behalf of TU WIen about the ongoing research within my PhD.

item.title: Intelligent Service Adaptations through Active Inference Agents
item.description: In Oxford I had the opportunity to exchange with high-class researchers involved in Active Inference, a concept from neuroscience, which we are trying to incorporate into computer science to improve the reactivity of software components.
